verses.verse: When<WH3588> you sit<WH3427> down<WH3427> to dine<WH9237> with a ruler,<WH4910> Consider<WH995> carefully<WH995> what<WH834> is before<WH6440> you;
And put<WH7760> a knife<WH7915> to your throat,<WH3930> If<WH518> you are a man<WH1167> of [great] appetite.<WH5315>
Do not desire<WH183> his delicacies,<WH4303> For it is deceptive<WH3577> food.<WH3899>
Do not weary<WH3021> yourself to gain<WH6238> wealth,<WH6238> Cease<WH2308> from your consideration<WH998> [of it.]

When you set<WH5774> your eyes<WH5869> on it, it is gone.<WH369> For [wealth] certainly<WH6213> makes<WH6213> itself wings,<WH3671> Like an eagle<WH5404> that flies<WH5774> [toward] the heavens.<WH8064>

For as he thinks<WH8176> within himself,<WH5315> so<WH3651> he is. He says<WH559> to you, "Eat<WH398> and drink!<WH8354>" But his heart<WH3820> is not with you.
You will vomit<WH9513> up the morsel<WH6595> you have eaten,<WH398> And waste<WH7843> your compliments.<WH1697> <WH5273>
Do not speak<WH1696> in the hearing<WH241> of a fool,<WH3684> For he will despise<WH936> the wisdom<WH7922> of your words.<WH4405>
Do not move<WH5472> the ancient<WH5769> boundary,<WH1366> Or go<WH935> into the fields<WH7704> of the fatherless;<WH3490>
For their Redeemer<WH1350> is strong;<WH2389> He will plead<WH7378> their case<WH7379> against<WH854> you.
Apply<WH935> your heart<WH3820> to discipline,<WH4148> And your ears<WH241> to words<WH561> of knowledge.<WH1847>
Do not hold<WH4513> back<WH4513> discipline<WH4148> from the child,<WH5288> Although<WH3588> you beat<WH5221> him with the rod,<WH7626> he will not die.<WH4191>
You shall beat<WH5221> him with the rod,<WH7626> And deliver<WH5337> his soul<WH5315> from Sheol.<WH7585>
My son,<WH1121> if<WH518> your heart<WH3820> is wise,<WH2449> My own heart<WH3820> also<WH1571> will be glad;<WH8055>
And my inmost<WH3629> being<WH3629> will rejoice,<WH5937> When your lips<WH8193> speak<WH1696> what<WH4339> is right.<WH4339>
Do not let your heart<WH3820> envy<WH7065> sinners,<WH2400> But [live] in the fear<WH3374> of the Lord<WH3068> always.<WH3605> <WH3117>
Surely<WH3588> <WH518> there<WH3426> is a future,<WH319> And your hope<WH8615> will not be cut<WH3772> off.<WH3772>
Listen,<WH8085> my son,<WH1121> and be wise,<WH2449> And direct<WH833> your heart<WH3820> in the way.<WH1870>
Do not be with heavy<WH9352> drinkers<WH9352> of wine,<WH3196> [Or] with gluttonous<WH9105> eaters<WH9105> of meat;<WH1320>
For the heavy<WH9352> drinker<WH9352> and the glutton<WH9105> will come<WH3423> to poverty,<WH3423> And drowsiness<WH5124> will clothe<WH3847> [a man] with rags.<WH7168>
Listen<WH8085> to your father who begot<WH1> you, And do not despise<WH3205> your mother<WH936> when<WH517> she is old.<WH3588>
Buy<WH7069> truth,<WH571> and do not sell<WH4376> [it,] [Get] wisdom<WH2451> and instruction<WH4148> and understanding.<WH998>
The father of the righteous<WH1> will greatly<WH6662> rejoice,<WH1524> And he who begets<WH1523> a wise<WH3205> son<WH2450> will be glad<WH2450> in him.
Let your father and your mother<WH1> be glad,<WH517> And let her rejoice<WH8055> who gave<WH1523> birth<WH3205> to you.
Give<WH5414> me your heart,<WH3820> my son,<WH1121> And let your eyes<WH5869> delight<WH7521> in my ways.<WH1870>
For a harlot<WH2181> is a deep<WH6013> pit,<WH7745> And an adulterous<WH5237> woman<WH5237> is a narrow<WH9495> well.<WH875>
Surely<WH637> she lurks<WH693> as a robber,<WH2863> And increases<WH3254> the faithless<WH898> among men.<WH120>

Who<WH4310> has woe<WH190>? Who<WH4310> has sorrow<WH17>? Who<WH4310> has contentions<WH4066>? Who<WH4310> has complaining<WH7879>? Who<WH4310> has wounds<WH6482> without<WH2600> cause<WH2600>? Who<WH4310> has redness<WH2448> of eyes<WH5869>?
Those who linger<WH309> long over<WH5921> wine,<WH3196> Those who go<WH935> to taste<WH2713> mixed<WH4469> wine.<WH4469>
Do not look<WH7200> on the wine<WH3196> when<WH3588> it is red,<WH119> When<WH3588> it sparkles<WH5414> <WH5869> in the cup,<WH3563> When it goes<WH1980> down<WH1980> smoothly;<WH4339>
At the last<WH319> it bites<WH5391> like a serpent,<WH5175> And stings<WH9462> like a viper.<WH9494>
Your eyes<WH5869> will see<WH7200> strange<WH2114> things,<WH2114> And your mind<WH3820> will utter<WH1696> perverse<WH8419> things.<WH8419>
And you will be like one who lies<WH7901> down<WH7901> in the middle<WH3820> of the sea,<WH3220> Or like one who lies<WH7901> down<WH7901> on the top<WH7218> of a mast.<WH2260>

"They struck<WH5221> me, [but] I did not become<WH2470> ill;<WH2470> They beat<WH1986> me, [but] I did not know<WH3045> [it.] When<WH4970> shall I awake<WH9516>? I will seek<WH1245> another<WH5750> <WH3254> drink."
